name: spatter
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to drop small drops of liquid, etc. on a surface, or (of liquid) to fall, especially noisily, in small drops: Two bikes raced by and spattered mud over our clothes. The bikes spattered them with mud. They could hear raindrops spattering on the roof of the car.
More examplesFewer examplesReduce the flame to low otherwise the oil will spatter all over the kitchen.The spray went wide, spattering her face and hands.The blood seemed more like paint spattered from an artist's brush.

More examplesFewer examplesA spatter of water came off the stone steps.Police noticed blood spatters on the home's floor.All mechanical systems pose risks of dropping small components, or at least a spatter of grease.
